name: Caipirinha (Brazil)
instructions: Place the lime wedges and sugar into an Old Fashioned glass
Muddle well to release the lime juice and dissolve the sugar
Fill the glass with crushed ice
Pour the cachaça over the ice
Stir gently to combine the ingredients
Serve with a stirrer or a short straw

name: Pisco Sour (Peru)
instructions: Add Pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white to a cocktail shaker
Perform a 'dry shake' (shake without ice) for about 15 seconds to emulsify the egg white
Add ice to the shaker and shake again vigorously for about 30 seconds until well-chilled
Strain into a chilled coupe or rocks glass
Garnish with 3 to 4 drops of Angostura bitters on top of the foam

name: Aperol Spritz (Italy)
ingredients: 1 ounce soda water or sparkling water
instructions: Fill a large wine glass with ice cubes
Pour in the Prosecco
Add the Aperol
Top with a splash of soda water
Stir gently to combine
Garnish with a fresh orange slice

name: Horchata (Mexico)
instructions: In a bowl, combine the rice, cinnamon stick, and hot water
Let it soak for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight
Remove the cinnamon stick and pour the rice and water into a blender
Blend on high until the rice is finely ground
Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth into a pitcher
Press the solids to extract all the liquid, then discard the solids
Stir in the milk, sugar, and vanilla extract until the sugar is dissolved
Chill thoroughly in the refrigerator
Serve over ice and dust with ground cinnamon before serving

name: Irish Coffee (Ireland)
instructions: Preheat a heatproof glass mug by filling it with hot water and then pouring it out
Add the brown sugar to the warm mug
Pour in the hot coffee and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved
Add the Irish whiskey and stir again
Gently float the lightly whipped cream on top by pouring it over the back of a warm spoon
Do not stir. The drink is meant to be drunk through the cool cream

name: Mango Lassi (India)
ingredients: 1 cup chopped ripe mango (fresh or frozen)
2-4 teaspoons sugar or honey, to taste
instructions: Place the yogurt, milk, mango, and sweetener in a blender
Add a pinch of cardamom if desired
Blend until completely smooth and creamy
If the lassi is too thick, add a little more milk and blend again
Taste and adjust sweetness if necessary
Pour into chilled glasses
Garnish with a fresh mint leaf and serve immediately

name: Sake (Nihonshu - Japan)
ingredients: Sake of your choice (e.g., Junmai, Ginjo)
instructions: Sake can be served chilled, at room temperature, or warm, depending on the type and personal preference
To serve chilled, refrigerate the bottle for a few hours before serving
To serve warm (atsukan), pour sake into a ceramic flask (tokkuri)
Place the tokkuri in a pan of water and heat gently. Do not boil. The ideal temperature is around 40-45°C (104-113°F)
Pour from the tokkuri into small ceramic cups (ochoko or sakazuki)
Sip slowly and appreciate the complex flavors

name: Teh Tarik (Malaysia)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons black tea powder or 2 black tea bags
instructions: Steep the black tea in hot water for about 5 minutes to create a strong brew
Strain the tea into a mug or heatproof cup
Add the sweetened condensed milk and stir until dissolved
Now for the 'pulling' (tarik): Pour the tea mixture into another mug from a height
Pour it back and forth between the two mugs several times
The pulling cools the tea and creates its signature frothy top
Increase the height of the pour as you get more confident to create more froth
Serve hot and frothy

name: Sangria (Spain)
ingredients: 1 bottle (750ml) of dry red wine (like Rioja)
1 cup sparkling water or club soda, chilled
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the red wine, orange slices, lemon slices, and chopped apple
Stir in the brandy and sugar until the sugar is dissolved
Add the orange juice and stir again
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or up to overnight, to allow the flavors to meld
Just before serving, top off with chilled sparkling water
Serve in glasses over ice, ensuring each glass gets some fruit

name: Chapman (Nigeria)
ingredients: Slices of cucumber, lemon, and orange for garnish
instructions: Fill a large mug or glass with ice cubes
Pour in the Fanta and Sprite
Add the dashes of Angostura bitters
Pour in the grenadine for color and sweetness
Stir gently to combine everything
Garnish with slices of cucumber, lemon, and orange
Serve with a straw and enjoy this refreshing Nigerian mocktail
